intro: Linociera lingelsheimiana, commonly known as the dwarf hibiscus, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
